meanings.def: to become tired and feel as if you want to sleep or rest; to make somebody feel this way
examples: Her legs were beginning to tire.
He has made a good recovery but still tires easily.
Walking even a short distance tires him.
She found herself tiring more quickly these days.

meanings.def: to do something a lot, especially in a way that annoys people
examples: He went to Harvard—as he never tires of reminding us.

idioms.def: to do something a lot, especially in a way that annoys people
examples: He went to Harvard—as he never tires of reminding us.

related: the Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company

meanings.def: a thick rubber ring that fits around the edge of a wheel of a car, bicycle, etc.
examples: Someone had slashed the tires on her car.
He drove off with a screech of tires.
Remember to check your tire pressure regularly.

meanings.def: to test the quality of something to see whether it is suitable for you before you buy it

idioms.def: to test the quality of something to see whether it is suitable for you before you buy it
